meanings.definition: The production of living organisms from other living organisms.
meanings.sent1: Biogeneses is the process of new life forms coming from existing ones.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study biogeneses to understand how living things reproduce.
meanings.sent3: In the magical world of biogeneses, frogs could turn into princes!
meanings.sent4: The forest seemed like a place of endless biogeneses, with new plants sprouting everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The concept of biogeneses is like a beautiful dance of life, where each organism plays its part.

meanings.definition: The theory that living organisms can only arise from preexisting living organisms.
meanings.sent1: According to biogeneses, life can only come from other life forms.
meanings.sent2: Biogeneses contradicts the idea of spontaneous generation.
meanings.sent3: The classroom discussion on biogeneses turned into a lively debate about chicken and egg origins!
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a testament to the principle of biogeneses, as each plant seemed to give birth to the next.
meanings.sent5: The concept of biogeneses is a reminder that life is a continuous chain, with each link connected to the next.
